main.structure

Class FrequencyTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.structure.FrequencyTable

  • public class FrequencyTable
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used by the Entropy and Gini algorithm in order to process the data in a dataList easier. It is meant to be made from one column of a dataList where the attributes are the possible values of that column, and the types are the possible classification types. The data can be accessed by either using two integers like a 2d array, or by using the attribute and type names like a hashtable.
    Author:
    Dan Martin

      • FrequencyTable

        Constructs a frequency table

    • Method Detail

      • setTypes

        public void setTypes(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> t)
        Sets the possible type values.
        Parameters:
        t - a vector of Strings, one for each type possible in the dataList.

      • setAttributes

        public void setAttributes(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object> a)
        Sets the possible Attributes. This can be string data like "red","green","blue", or numbers for the possible bins for numeric data.
        Parameters:
        a - a vector of the possible attributes, one for each attribute in a single column of the dataList.

      • increment

        public void increment(java.lang.Object a,
                      java.lang.String t)
        Increments the value at the index specified by using some attribute and type name.
        Parameters:
        a - the attribute that needs to be incremented
        t - the type value that corresponds to the attribute to be incremented.

      • getValue

        public int getValue(java.lang.Object a,
                    java.lang.String t)
        Gets the value of the index specified by the attribute and type (like a hashtable)
        Parameters:
        a - the value used to access the attribute part of the table.
        t - the value used to access the type part of the table.
        Returns:
        the value at the index specified by the attribute and type.

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Integer getValue(int a,
                                  int t)
        Treats the frequencyTable as a 2d array with the Attributes as the rows and types as columns.
        Parameters:
        a - the index of the attribute to access.
        t - the index of the type to access.
        Returns:
        the value at the index specified by the attribute and type.

      • getTypesSize

        public int getTypesSize()
        Gets the number of types in the table.
        Returns:
        the number of types in the table.

      • getAttributesSize

        public int getAttributesSize()
        Gets the number of attributes in the table.
        Returns:
        the number of attributes in the table.

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType(int i)
        Gets the type needed to access a specific index of the table.
        Parameters:
        i - the index to look.
        Returns:
        returns a String that corresponds to the type used to access that index of the table.

      • getAttribute

        public java.lang.Object getAttribute(int i)
        Gets the attribute needed to access a specific index of the table.
        Parameters:
        i - the index to look.
        Returns:
        returns a Object that corresponds to the attribute used to access that index of the table.

      • getTotal

        public int getTotal(java.lang.Object a)
        Gets the sum of each frequency table entry for some attribute. Basically just returns the sum of the row accessed by the attribute a.
        Parameters:
        a - the attribute that corresponds to the row to sum up.
        Returns:
        the sum of the row.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        completely resets the frequency table.
